p: Another example for RUNX1/RUNX1T1-exerted control of an alternative TSS is provided by the RPS6KA1 locus. RUNX1/RUNX1T1 binds to a site in intron 1 located 12 kb downstream of TSS1 (Fig. 8a). Loss of RUNX1/RUNX1T1 binding results in a threefold increase in transcript and protein levels in t(8;21) AML cells (Fig. 8a, Cufflinks panel; Fig. 8b, c). This increase is mainly due to the twentyfold activation of TSS2 located in direct proximity downstream of the RUNX1/RUNX1T1 binding site.
